body:
What is an `.idea/` folder for?

If this is something local to your development environment (project files or soemthing), I recommend putting it into a global `~/.gitignore` file. You can tell git to use it globally with the following code in your `~/.gitconfig`:

```
[core]
  excludesfile = ~/.gitignore
```

You can add `.idea/` to your local `~/.gitignore` then and remove the change from this PR.

body_text:
What is an .idea/ folder for?
If this is something local to your development environment (project files or soemthing), I recommend putting it into a global ~/.gitignore file. You can tell git to use it globally with the following code in your ~/.gitconfig:
[core]
  excludesfile = ~/.gitignore

You can add .idea/ to your local ~/.gitignore then and remove the change from this PR.
